import React from 'react'; import './styles.scss'; import { useState } from 'react'; class Detail extends React.Component { state = {}; constructor(props) { super(props); // Use the Data array as the initial state this.state = { data: [ { id: "123", name: "thanh thuy", birthday: "20/12/2002", phone: "154625321469", email: "thuy@gmail.com", address: "32 cgs dhdg dhđ dhy" }, { id: "321", name: "thanh thuy", birthday: "20/12/2002", phone: "154625321469", email: "thuy@gmail.com", address: "32 cgs dhdg dhđ dhy" }, { id: "258", name: "thanh thuy", birthday: "20/12/2002", phone: "154625321469", email: "thuy@gmail.com", address: "32 cgs dhdg dhđ dhy" } ], currentPage: 1, itemsPerPage: 10, }; } handleClick = (pageNumber) => { this.setState({ currentPage: pageNumber, }); }; render() { const { data, currentPage, itemsPerPage } = this.state; // Calculate the index range for the current page const indexOfLastItem = currentPage * itemsPerPage; const indexOfFirstItem = indexOfLastItem - itemsPerPage; const currentItems = data.slice(indexOfFirstItem, indexOfLastItem); return (
